events.name: Inspiration from biological scaling for cities: structure, tradeoffs, and ultimate limitations
events.description:
Abstract: 
Chris will present some recent efforts in biological scaling that allows us to predict both compositional trade-offs across the vast diversity of life and detailed ecological structure, and he will discuss how these might serve as inspiration for the developing theory of urban complexity. Chris will begin with the recent efforts to predict forest structure as a function of resource limitations. He will then discuss a theory for compositional trade-offs in organism physiology across the scales of life. In both systems, Chris will show how we can predict the minimum and maximum sizes associated with particular living architectures. Chris will then draw analogies between these systems and urban scaling while pointing towards future directions for the developing theory of cities.

Speaker: 
Chris Kempes is an Omidyar Fellow at the Santa Fe Institute and received his Ph.D. from MIT in physical biology. He has also been a visiting graduate student and postdoctoral fellow at Caltech and a postdoctoral fellow at NASA Ames Research Center. Specific theories developed for individual processes or contexts are important and useful, but finding general principles that apply across vast amounts of phenomena is a central goal in science. In the broadest terms, this is Chris’ goal, to find theories and principles that apply to a wide range of biological scales and hierarchies.
Chris generally focuses his work on biological architecture—which may include phenomena ranging from explicit biological morphology to metabolic and genetic network structure—as an intermediate between organism physiology and environmental conditions. Mathematical and physical theories lie at the heart of his methodologies to predict how evolution has shaped architecture and how this, in turn, forms a foundation for reliable predictions of environmental response and interaction. His work spans the scales of genetic information architecture to the morphology of microbial individuals and communities to the regional variation of plant traits and their feedback with climate and available resources. In so doing, he aims to connect these first-order trends to the limitations imposed by environments in order to predict specific evolutionary events and consequences. Several collaborations with experimentalists and theorists have led to models that inform experiments and assimilate empirical data in fields including single-cell experimental biology and forest dynamics.
events.location: Value Lab Asia, Singapore-ETH Centre, #06-01, CREATE Tower, 1 CREATE Way, Singapore 138602
events.group_name: Future Cities Laboratory (FCL) at the Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: AIRSWAP and the New Token Economy
events.description:
The project: In this presentation we welcome Michael Oved to discuss the popularity and power of a new class of digital assets called tokens. Tokens have been called the killer app of blockchain, as they’ve been used successfully in recent months to fund a growing number of promising blockchain projects and companies. We will then present AIRSWAP, designed from the ground up to support this new token economy as a decentralized, peer-to-peer token trading platform. By collecting and aggregating personalized orders from peers around the world, AIRSWAP users create and manage “personalized order books” to trade with privacy, security, and choice. AIRSWAP is based on the Swap Protocol, which can support a variety of decentralized exchange solutions including personalized order books. We believe this design will provide ample liquidity and competitive pricing for the new token economy worldwide. Please RSVP at this eventbrite link for a ticket which must be presented at the door!   Timeline of Event: 18:30 - 19:00 : Registration 19:00 - 20:00 : Keynote 20:00-20:30 : Networking 20:30 onwards : Closing Off Organizing partners:     MING Labs is a leading digital business builder located in Berlin, Munich, New York, Shanghai and Singapore. We work with some of the world’s most well-known brands and truly dedicated entrepreneurs to craft next-generation services and solutions with them. 

Venue Sponsor:  Collision 8 - A co-working space located in downtown Singapore offering workspace to a curated community of innovators from diverse backgrounds.
events.location: Collision 8 High Street Centre, 1 North Bridge Road #08-08, Singapore

events.name: iOS Dev Scout August 2017 Meetup
events.description:
Venue: SP Group 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Keppel Tower 2 Singapore[masked] Speakers: • Benjamin Cheah - UX Designer, creator of Yomap • Maciej Piotrowski - iOS Developer Agenda: • 6:30pm: Food and refreshments (Sponsored by SP Group), say hello to other iOS devs • 7:15pm: Reducing Code Complexity with ReactiveCocoa and MVVM - by Benjamin • 7:45pm: Review all the things! - by Maciej • 8:15pm: Show & Tell, quiz with collectibles to be won! About the Topics: • Benjamin will share his experiences on Reactive programming, which makes it a breeze to manage asynchronous tasks like HTTP requests but it's even more useful when it comes to complex software with a lot of moving parts. He’ll show how ReactiveCocoa and MVVM is used in his app to separate presentation and logic. He’ll also explore other cases where ReactiveCocoa excels over existing design patterns. • Maciej will share on his topic "Review all the things!": I have a vision, where unit testing and code review are a standard, not an opt-in feature in iOS development. I've been fighting a lot to introduce them at my workplace. Let me tell you what things get reviewed in other industries and why it is so. Join the talk if you want to start code review practices at your company, but you don't know how to kick it off. 


iOS Conf SG 2017 iOS Conf SG 2017 will be happening on the 19th and 20th October 2017. Follow us at @iOSConfSG for the latest updates on the conference.  We have opened our slack group to everyone this year to provide a platform for all to meet up with like-minded developers, collaborate with one another and become friends for life. Register here to join the iOS Conf SG Slackgroup: https://slackpass.io/iosconfsg Check out our Facebook page for the latest updates: https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/ Get your tickets now at: </a><a href="https://iosconfsg-2017.eventbrite.com/">https://iosconfsg-2017.eventbrite.com <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/"></a>
events.location: SP Group, 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Keppel Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: Kubernetes at Lazada
events.description:
Hello Kublets 


Please join me for the next Singapore Kubernetes User Group hosted by the Lazada group. 


Seats are limited to 30 so please only RSVP if you intend to come. Please confirm RSVP in below form: https://goo.gl/forms/O6Lx7zKoV5sHomiB2 



• Topic 1 - Kubernetes Logging at Lazada • Topic 2 - Kubernetes Tips and Tricks  


Kubernetes Logging at Lazada  by Yuri Bushmelev - Senior System Engineer at Lazada. At Lazada, we run our site and mobile application’ server API as a set of micro-services in dockerized environment.  We use Kubernetes for a while in our dev/test environment and recently started to introduce it in production.   In this talk we discuss how we are collecting and delivering logs in such environment.  Kuberctl Tips and Tricks   by Vincent Serpoul - Manulife Vincent will cover Kubernetes tips and tricks.
events.location: Lazada, Level 8 AXA Tower, 8 Shenton Way, Singapore 068811

events.name: Talk.CSS #20
events.description: Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. The CSS doctor is inLayouts looking a bit broken? CSS issues getting you down? We're here to help. Tell us your CSS problem and get a crowd-sourced solution from all the CSS enthusiasts in Singapore right here. Speakers TBC. Have something you want to share? Let us know! Lightning talks welcome, just poke Chris or Huijing when you get there. We welcome any CSS-related topics at ANY level because we’re all here to learn and share :)

events.name: What we've learnt from working with high-performance systems at PocketMath
events.description: * Abstract Java is among favorite languages for developers who build high-performance systems. Pocketmath has been building their high performance, low latency platform using Java 8, and their platform can serve up to 1 million requests per second with an average response time of 0.6 millisecond.  In this talk, Tomas and Tony from Pocketmath would like to share with you their strategy and experience from building this system. * SpeakersTony Nguyen is a veteran developer with 11 years working on various Java project. He is currently the Head of Engineering in Pocketmath with the mission to improve system performance and stability. He is also the owner of the local Java blog sgdev-blog.blogspot.com Tomas Libal works in the area of real-time bidding in online advertising. Currently at Pocketmath, he integrates third party ad exchanges with Pocketmath systems and ensures that the performance requirements for low latency and the volume levels are met. His background is in mathematics and auction theory and is actively interested in both.

events.name: FREE HANDS-ON TRAINING: ASP.NET Core 2.0 with IdentityServer4
events.description: Hi all, Due to high demand from members. We agree to make a FREE Hands-On Training for anyone who wants to learn ASP.NET Core 2.0 with IdentityServer4 for Web App, Web API and deploy to Azure/AWS. This is for Level 200+ and above. Sorry for the short time scheduling. We also only have 60 seat that has table for this session. Make sure you the first to register and really, really, really want to attend, otherwise, please give others a chance to learn if you unable to join.  What you will get from the Hands-On Training: Speaker/Trainer: Riza Marhaban, Mentors: Paul, Dawa, Chun Lin, Kien.Identity Theory: (will be announce at the venue) • Short Theory on OpeinId Connect (OAuth2) protocol. • Brief on IdentityServer4 (OpenId Connect Certified and Compliance). • Creating ASP.NET Core 2.0 MVC (with no Login page). • Creating ASP.NET Core 2.0 Web API. • Wire Identity services with the MVC and Web API Client. • Create VM on Azure/AWS. Setup Web Deployment on the VM. • Adding Self-Signing certificate with private key using PowerShell. • Deploying the Web App to VM through Visual Studio Publish. • Adding a domain name for the application (e.g. mydomain.com, api.mydomain.com, identity.mydomain.com). PREREQUISITES • Please bring your own device/laptop (BYOD). • Install Visual Studio[masked] Preview 1.0 (enable Cross-Platform .NET Core components when installing). • Azure/AWS account if you want to follow the deployment on cloud. For this session, we are sorry that we cannot get sponsor food for now, maybe next time. Make sure you already had food, eat first. :) WiFi: YES I hope you can join. Many thanks for the support and see you at the venue! Enjoy! Organizer,Riza Marhaban
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Coding/Programming Bootcamp Infosession
events.description:
Want to experience ALPHA Camp before signing up for our courses?
Join us at the upcoming Bootcamp Infosession to discover how ALPHA Camp’s programme can help you achieve your goals.

Key Topic:
-Find out the key advantages of learning at ALPHA Camp and how our programmes are different from other training providers' programmes.
